content:
You have to love the Microsoft Idea of a useful error message.

They could have simplified it to your sending as whatever@outlook.com and must log in as whatever@outlook.com. You are not allowed to use this account to send as Whatever@hotmail.com.

Go to the outgoing server (smtp) entry in account settings and make sure oyu have an entry for both the outlook account and the hotmail account. Give them distinctive names like the email address and server they should work with.

Then go to your incoming mail account in Account settings and select the identity (that is the part above the server settings) and set the correct outgoing server for use with both the relevant accounts.

Note: there should be one SMTP server configured for every incoming account. You can not reuse them for another account. You used to be able to do that. Not any longer.

content:
Questo comportamento si verifica quando una mail è stata inviata con il campo data vuoto o non valido. Il client (in questo caso Thunderbird) deve attribuire alla mail una data convenzionale che in questo caso è la data in cui il messaggio è stato scaricato. La stessa email sul server probabilmente avrà la data del giorno in cui è arrivata.

Purtroppo non è risolvibile nel senso che l'errore è a monte.

content: The unified folders area only accounts for folders that exist in accounts and have the same name, such as Sent. The folders that appear below, under the account name, are folders whose names are unique to that account. If you invoke the "All Folders" option, you will see all folders together.

creator: parsec1966

content:
Con IMAP la situazione è potenzialmente problematica perché di solito vengono scaricati localmente solo i messaggi che vengono letti mentre per gli altri si scarica solo l'intestazione.

  • Metti OFFLINE il secondo PC dove è ancora presenta la cartella
  • Assicurati che i messaggi sia effettivamente presente provando a visualizzarli
  • In Thunderbird, sotto Cartelle locali, crea una nuova cartella di appoggio
  • Copia le mail presenti dalla cartella che vuoi recuperare alla cartella di appoggio (per copiare i messaggi selezionali a blocchi di un centinaio e poi trascinali con il mouse tenendo premuto il tasto Ctrl)
  • A questo punto verifica che i messaggi siano ancora presenti nella cartella che vuoi ripristinare ed in quella di appoggio. Se è tutto OK procedi
  • Porta online il PC e lascia che Thunderbird si sincronizzi
  • Se i messaggi nella cartella da recuperare restano al loro posto dovresti poi ritrovarli anche sul server
  • Se la cartella da recuperare si svuota, copia i messaggi dalla cartella di appoggio alla cartella Posta in arrivo dell'account su cui stai lavorando. Attenzione a fare una copia e non a spostare i messaggi! E poi lascia che Thunderbird si sincronizzi

Per ulteriore cautela fai una copia su file della cartella che vuoi recuperare. Ad esempio utilizzando questa estensione -> https://addons.thunderbird.net/it/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

content:
Gregory said
Even NOW I TRY to put a new mail the thunderbird settings for imap was outlook.office365.com port 993. So something is wrong with mozilla thunderbird NOT ME.

If that is the case, why does it work for me and not you?

Do you tell me to change the port into 587? But the same port 993 use the gmail and yahoo mail servers without any issue so what is happening with outlook mail servers???

Each mail provider has setting decided by the mail provider as to what will be needed to connect to the mail server. So your settings for Yahoo or even Gmail have no relevance to what Microsoft decide is their requirement.

This is the settings Thunderbird will use for outlook domains. https://autoconfig.thunderbird.net/v1.1/hotmail.com

Now to the important part of this. You have two accounts with Outlook for every mail address. One to receive mail, which will be an IMAP or POP account unless you use the OWL addon. The other will be an outgoing account and it will use the port 587. Your incoming account will use port 993 or 005 depending on if it is IMAP or POP. I know you probably find all this confusing, but setting up a mail client is an exercise in copying what the provider tells you to use, not creative guessing.

Most folk that have issues setting up account with outlook have issues with their antivirus causing the process to fail. I use windows defender which has few components that mess with mail. Third party antivirus products have spam, scam and advanced threat detection, which means generally it is that far integrated in the download process that when it fails, everything fails. I do not have that sort of product and have no issue. I also do not use a VPN which is another prime cause of mail download failures.

content: YES, but first do some homework. Do they both have desktop icons? Do they both access the same profile? Right-click on a desktop icon to see where each is stored. If in program files (x86), that would be a 32-bit version. Is one a beta? what are their release numbers (click help>about to see that). Some installs might accidentally uninstall both. If one is running the version you want, I would just go into Windows file explorer and delete the one not wanted. That sends it to the recycle bin. Start thunderbird and if all is working -- which I expect, you're done. If not, you may have deleted the wrong one. In recycle bin, just click to restore and start over.

content: Unfortunately, the threading setting is a baseline, not a universal setting. That is, the setting is applied to NEW folders after the setting has been set. If you have already created folders, then you would need to reset them after the baseline in config editor was changed. There are simple keystrokes that allow you to set one folder and then apply those settings to all other folders in an account. I agree that such a setting is desirable, but it isn't. That request has appeared almost daily since threading became the default in 2022.
creator: davidsk
